com.tejasmehta.OdometryCore.math

Class CoreMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tejasmehta.OdometryCore.math.CoreMath

  • public class CoreMath
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to house and handle all the math methods for three wheel odometry

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CoreMath() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double getAverageHeading(double previousHeading, double headingChange)
      A method to get the average heading to rotate the localized vector by (in radians) Sourced from the formula AverageHeading = PreviousHeading + HeadingChange/2
      static CartesianCoordinate getConvertedCoordinate(double leftChange, double rightChange, double frontBackChange, double leftOffset, double rightOffset, double frontBackOffset)
      A method to take the left and right encoders' new values, old values, as well as the change of the front/back encoder paired with the offset of all 3 to calculate a localized Cartesian Coordinate after performing relative calculations
      static CartesianCoordinate getConvertedCoordinate(double currentLeftPosition, double currentRightPosition, double currentFrontBackPosition, double previousLeftPosition, double previousRightPosition, double previousFrontBackPosition, double leftOffset, double rightOffset, double frontBackOffset)
      A method to take the left and right encoders' new values, old values, as well as the change of the front/back encoder paired with the offset of all 3 to calculate a localized Cartesian Coordinate after performing relative calculations
      static CartesianCoordinate getConvertedCoordinate(PolarCoordinate polarCoordinate, double absoluteHeading)
      A method to take a relative polar coordinate and an absolute heading to convert the polar coordinate to a localized Cartesian coordinate
      static double getHeading(double leftChange, double rightChange, double leftOffset, double rightOffset)
      A method to get the current heading in radians of the robot given the following parameters Sourced from the formula: Δθ = (ΔR - ΔL)/(leftOffset + rightOffset)
      static OdometryPosition getOdometryPosition(double leftChange, double rightChange, double frontBackChange, double leftOffset, double rightOffset, double frontBackOffset, double previousHeading)
      A method to calculate the odometry position global vector given the offsets and changes of each wheel along with the previous heading Essentially calculates the length of both x and y vectors, converts them to Polar coordinates with the average heading, and then adds their opposite values together to give a new position
      static PolarCoordinate getPolarCoordinate(double rawXCoordinate, double rawYCoordinate)
      A method to take both the raw X and Y coordinates and convert them to an equivalent polar cooordinate
      static PolarCoordinate getPolarCoordinate(double leftChange, double rightChange, double frontBackChange, double leftOffset, double rightOffset, double frontBackOffset)
      A method to take the changes in the left, right, and front/back odometry wheels, along with their respective offsets to create a polar coordinate after getting their raw x and y coordinates (still not localized)
      static double getRawXCoordinate(double frontBackChange, double frontBackOffset, double headingChange)
      A method to get the raw X coordinate (no conversion to the local plane yet) by utilizing the change in the front/back odometry wheel and its offset Sourced from the formula 2sin(θ/2) * (ΔS/Δθ + forwardBackwardOffset)
      static double getRawYCoordinate(double leftChange, double rightChange, double leftOffset, double rightOffset, double headingChange)
      A method to get the raw Y coordinate (no conversion to the local plane yet) via averaging the X coordinate results from both the right and left coordinate methods, mainly for accuracy and consistency between both sides in case one side is a little off
      static double getRawYCoordinateWithLeftOnly(double leftChange, double leftOffset, double headingChange)
      A method to get the raw Y coordinate (no conversion to the local plane yet) by utilizing only the change and offset of the left wheel Sourced from the formula: 2sin(θ/2) * (ΔL/Δθ - leftOffset)
      static double getRawYCoordinateWithRightOnly(double rightChange, double rightOffset, double headingChange)
      A method to get the raw Y coordinate (no conversion to the local plane yet) by utilizing only the change and offset of the right wheel Sourced from the formula: 2sin(θ/2) * (ΔR/Δθ + rightOffset)
      static double simplifyRadians(double radians)
      A method to simplify a radian count into a count between 0 and 2π by counting the excess multiplicity and removing it
      static double ticksToInches(double ticks, double cpr, double diameter)
      A method to convert encoder ticks to their respective inch measurement given a cpr and diameter

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • CoreMath

        public CoreMath()

    • Method Detail

      • simplifyRadians

        public static double simplifyRadians(double radians)
        A method to simplify a radian count into a count between 0 and 2π by counting the excess multiplicity and removing it
        Parameters:
        radians - - The count in radians (may be above or below 0 - 2π)
        Returns:
        - The simplified radian count (will be between 0 and 2π)

      • ticksToInches

        public static double ticksToInches(double ticks,
                                   double cpr,
                                   double diameter)
        A method to convert encoder ticks to their respective inch measurement given a cpr and diameter
        Parameters:
        ticks - - The amount of elapsed ticks
        cpr - - The amount of counts per rotation for the encoder
        diameter - - The encoder wheel's diameter
        Returns:
        - The inch measurement of the given ticks

      • getHeading

        public static double getHeading(double leftChange,
                                double rightChange,
                                double leftOffset,
                                double rightOffset)
        A method to get the current heading in radians of the robot given the following parameters Sourced from the formula: Δθ = (ΔR - ΔL)/(leftOffset + rightOffset)
        Parameters:
        leftChange - - The change in the left odometry wheel's movement (in inches)
        rightChange - - The change in the right odometry wheel's movement (in inches)
        leftOffset - - The horizontal offset of the left wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        rightOffset - - The horizontal offset of the right odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        Returns:
        - The radian value of the current heading

      • getAverageHeading

        public static double getAverageHeading(double previousHeading,
                                       double headingChange)
        A method to get the average heading to rotate the localized vector by (in radians) Sourced from the formula AverageHeading = PreviousHeading + HeadingChange/2
        Parameters:
        previousHeading - - The previous heading of the robot (in radians)
        headingChange - - The change in heading from the previous heading to the current one (in radians)
        Returns:
        - The average heading to rotate the local vector by (in radians)

      • getRawXCoordinate

        public static double getRawXCoordinate(double frontBackChange,
                                       double frontBackOffset,
                                       double headingChange)
        A method to get the raw X coordinate (no conversion to the local plane yet) by utilizing the change in the front/back odometry wheel and its offset Sourced from the formula 2sin(θ/2) * (ΔS/Δθ + forwardBackwardOffset)
        Parameters:
        frontBackChange - - The change in the front/back odometey wheel's movement (in inches)
        frontBackOffset - - The horizontal offset of the front/back odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        headingChange - - The change in the heading from the previous measurement (in radians)
        Returns:
        - The raw x coordinate (in inches) of the robot without the conversion to the local coordinate plane (relative to the robot)

      • getRawYCoordinate

        public static double getRawYCoordinate(double leftChange,
                                       double rightChange,
                                       double leftOffset,
                                       double rightOffset,
                                       double headingChange)
        A method to get the raw Y coordinate (no conversion to the local plane yet) via averaging the X coordinate results from both the right and left coordinate methods, mainly for accuracy and consistency between both sides in case one side is a little off
        Parameters:
        leftChange - - The change in the left odometry wheel's movement (in inches)
        rightChange - - The change in the right odometry wheel's movement (in inches)
        leftOffset - - The horizontal offset of the left odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        rightOffset - - The horizontal offset of the right odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        headingChange - - The change in the heading from the previous measurement (in radians)
        Returns:
        - The average of the results of both the `getRawYCoordinateWithRightOnly()` and `getRawYCoordinateWithLeftOnly()` methods (in inches)

      • getRawYCoordinateWithRightOnly

        public static double getRawYCoordinateWithRightOnly(double rightChange,
                                                    double rightOffset,
                                                    double headingChange)
        A method to get the raw Y coordinate (no conversion to the local plane yet) by utilizing only the change and offset of the right wheel Sourced from the formula: 2sin(θ/2) * (ΔR/Δθ + rightOffset)
        Parameters:
        rightChange - - The change in the right odometry wheel's movement (in inches)
        rightOffset - - The horizontal offset of the right odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        headingChange - - The change in heading from the previous measurement (in radians)
        Returns:
        - The raw y coordinate (in inches) of the robot without conversion to the local coordinate plane (relative to the robot)

      • getRawYCoordinateWithLeftOnly

        public static double getRawYCoordinateWithLeftOnly(double leftChange,
                                                   double leftOffset,
                                                   double headingChange)
        A method to get the raw Y coordinate (no conversion to the local plane yet) by utilizing only the change and offset of the left wheel Sourced from the formula: 2sin(θ/2) * (ΔL/Δθ - leftOffset)
        Parameters:
        leftChange - - The change in the left odometry wheel's movement (in inches)
        leftOffset - - The horizontal offset of the left odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        headingChange - - The change in heading from the previous measurement (in radians)
        Returns:
        - The raw y coordinate (in inches) of the robot without conversion to the local coordinate plane (relative to the robot)

      • getPolarCoordinate

        public static PolarCoordinate getPolarCoordinate(double leftChange,
                                                 double rightChange,
                                                 double frontBackChange,
                                                 double leftOffset,
                                                 double rightOffset,
                                                 double frontBackOffset)
        A method to take the changes in the left, right, and front/back odometry wheels, along with their respective offsets to create a polar coordinate after getting their raw x and y coordinates (still not localized)
        Parameters:
        leftChange - - The change in the left odometry wheel's movement (in inches)
        rightChange - - The change in the right odometry wheel's movement (in inches)
        frontBackChange - - The change in the front/back odometey wheel's movement (in inches)
        leftOffset - - The horizontal offset of the left odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        rightOffset - - The horizontal offset of the right odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        frontBackOffset - - The horizontal offset of the front/back odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        Returns:
        - The Polar coordinate that coincides with the robot's relative coordinate

      • getPolarCoordinate

        public static PolarCoordinate getPolarCoordinate(double rawXCoordinate,
                                                 double rawYCoordinate)
        A method to take both the raw X and Y coordinates and convert them to an equivalent polar cooordinate
        Parameters:
        rawXCoordinate - - The raw x coordinate that is still relative to the robot's position and not the local coordinate plane
        rawYCoordinate - - The raw y coordinate that is still relative to the robot's position and not the local coordinate plane
        Returns:
        - The polar coordinate that is equivalent to the raw cartesian coordinates given

      • getConvertedCoordinate

        public static CartesianCoordinate getConvertedCoordinate(double currentLeftPosition,
                                                         double currentRightPosition,
                                                         double currentFrontBackPosition,
                                                         double previousLeftPosition,
                                                         double previousRightPosition,
                                                         double previousFrontBackPosition,
                                                         double leftOffset,
                                                         double rightOffset,
                                                         double frontBackOffset)
        A method to take the left and right encoders' new values, old values, as well as the change of the front/back encoder paired with the offset of all 3 to calculate a localized Cartesian Coordinate after performing relative calculations
        Parameters:
        currentLeftPosition - - The current reported left encoder;s position (in inches)
        currentRightPosition - - The current reported right encoder's position (in inches)
        currentFrontBackPosition - - The current reported front/back encoder's position (in inches)
        previousLeftPosition - - The previous reported position of the left encoder (in inches)
        previousRightPosition - - The previous reported position of the right encoder (in inches)
        previousFrontBackPosition - - The previous reported position of the front/back encoder (in inches)
        leftOffset - - The horizontal offset of the left odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        rightOffset - - The horizontal offset of the right odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        frontBackOffset - - The horizontal offset of the front/back odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        Returns:
        - The converted Cartesian Coordinate on the local plane of the field

      • getConvertedCoordinate

        public static CartesianCoordinate getConvertedCoordinate(double leftChange,
                                                         double rightChange,
                                                         double frontBackChange,
                                                         double leftOffset,
                                                         double rightOffset,
                                                         double frontBackOffset)
        A method to take the left and right encoders' new values, old values, as well as the change of the front/back encoder paired with the offset of all 3 to calculate a localized Cartesian Coordinate after performing relative calculations
        Parameters:
        leftChange - - The current reported left encoder's positional change (in inches)
        rightChange - - The current reported right encoder's positional change (in inches)
        frontBackChange - - The current reported front/back encoder's position (in inches)
        leftOffset - - The horizontal offset of the left odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        rightOffset - - The horizontal offset of the right odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        frontBackOffset - - The vertical offset of the front/back odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        Returns:
        - The converted Cartesian Coordinate on the local plane of the field

      • getOdometryPosition

        public static OdometryPosition getOdometryPosition(double leftChange,
                                                   double rightChange,
                                                   double frontBackChange,
                                                   double leftOffset,
                                                   double rightOffset,
                                                   double frontBackOffset,
                                                   double previousHeading)
        A method to calculate the odometry position global vector given the offsets and changes of each wheel along with the previous heading Essentially calculates the length of both x and y vectors, converts them to Polar coordinates with the average heading, and then adds their opposite values together to give a new position
        Parameters:
        leftChange - - The current reported left encoder's positional change (in inches)
        rightChange - - The current reported right encoder's positional change (in inches)
        frontBackChange - - The current reported front/back encoder's positional change (in inches)
        leftOffset - - The horizontal offset of the left oodometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        rightOffset - - The horizontal offset of the right odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        frontBackOffset - - The vertical offset of the front/back odometry wheel from the robot's center (in inches)
        previousHeading - - The robot's previous heading (in radians)
        Returns:
        - An OdometryPosition with the robot's global vector (to be added to the previous one) and the robot's absolute heading

      • getConvertedCoordinate

        public static CartesianCoordinate getConvertedCoordinate(PolarCoordinate polarCoordinate,
                                                         double absoluteHeading)
        A method to take a relative polar coordinate and an absolute heading to convert the polar coordinate to a localized Cartesian coordinate
        Parameters:
        polarCoordinate - - The Polar Coordinate of the relative coordinate
        absoluteHeading - - The absolute heading of the robot (in radians)
        Returns:
        - The converted Cartesian Coordinate on the local plane of the field
